briefTitle: Study of Lanreotide Autogel in Non-functioning Entero-pancreatic Endocrine Tumours

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Endocrine tumour in the intestine or pancreas and with locally advanced or metastatic disease
* No hormone related symptoms
* Well or moderately differentiated tumour confirmed by histology
* Tumour lesions which are measurable by a CT or MRI scan

Exclusion Criteria:

* Previously treated with a somatostatin analogue unless more than 6 months ago and given for no more than 15 days
* Treated within the last 6 months with interferon, chemoembolisation or chemotherapy or at any time with a radionuclide
* Had a previous cancer except basal cell carcinoma and/or in situ carcinoma of the cervix/uterus and/or patients treated with curative intent and free from disease for 5 years
* Pregnant or lactating
* Females must use adequate contraception during the study

outcomeMeasures.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of disease progression, or death. Disease progression centrally assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) v1.0

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Patients Alive & Without Disease Progression
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of patients still ongoing (or completing at Week 96) without centrally assessed disease progression or death at Weeks 48 and 96.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pharmacokinetic Profile of Lanreotide
outcomeMeasures.description: Pharmacokinetic Profile of Lanreotide assessed by mean serum concentration at specified timepoints

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in the Global Health Status Quality of Life Assessment
outcomeMeasures.description: Transformed scores from European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) Quality of Life Questionnaire responses (QLQ)-C30. Questionnaire response scores range from 0 to 100. Higher scores indicate best possible Quality of Life.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Patients With a Greater Than or Equal to 50% Decrease in Plasma Chromogranin A (CgA) Levels
Percentage of Patients Still Alive Based on Available Overall Survival Data
outcomeMeasures.description: Overall survival defined as the time from randomisation to death due to any cause. Subjects were followed for overall survival beyond study completion/withdrawal via annual telephone contact until the last subject completed the study.
